It belongs to the family Bennettiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny, woody structure and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, where it adapts to cold and harsh climatic conditions. Bennettia affinis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and specialized ecological requirements.
